t: Proverbs 10
Contrast of the Righteous and the Wicked
The*p proverbs of Solomon. A*pn wise son makes a father glad, But*ln a foolish son is a grief to his mother.
Ill-gotten*ln gains do not profit, But*ln righteousness delivers from death.
The*ln Lord*s will not allow the righteous to hunger, But*ln He will reject the craving of the wicked.
Poor*ln is he who works with a negligent hand, But*ln the hand of the diligent makes rich.
He*ln who gathers in summer is a son who acts wisely, But*iln he who sleeps in harvest is a son who acts shamefully.
Blessings*ln are on the head of the righteous, But*ln the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
The*ln memory of the righteous is blessed, But*ln the name of the wicked will rot.
The*ln wise of heart will receive commands, But*ln a babbling fool will be ruined.

He*ln who winks the eye causes trouble, And*ln a babbling fool will be ruined.
The*ln mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, But*ln the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

On*ln the lips of the discerning, wisdom is found, But*ln a rod is for the back of him who lacks understanding.

The*ln rich manâ€™s wealth is his fortress, The*ln ruin of the poor is their poverty.

He*ln is on*i the path of life who heeds instruction, But*ln he who ignores reproof goes astray.

The*ln tongue of the righteous is as*i choice silver, The*ln heart of the wicked is worth*i little.
